FuncDef:
The ip dynamic-port command sets the port number range for an open system.
The undo ip dynamic-port command cancels the port number range setting for an open system. The ip dynamic-port command sets the port number range for an open system. The undo ip dynamic-port command cancels the port number range setting for an open system. By default, no port number range is specified for an open system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start port number.
The value is an integer in the range from 1025 to 65535.

Specifies the end port number.
The value is an integer in the range from 1025 to 65535.

ExtraInfo: In the open solution, a service app needs to communicate with a third-party app in the Linux OS. The port number range used for the communication must be specified. You can run this command to set the port number range. The service app subscribes to the configuration information of the command line to determine whether to communicate with the Linux system or with the internal system.
